EnhanceR Symposium 2024

Research IT contribution to FAIRness

  • Home
  • Timetable
  • Registration
  • EnhanceR Seminar

Preliminary Timetable

EnhanceR Symposium 2024 will take place at the Empa-Akademie on Thursday, November 7th, 2024.

If you are registered, you will receive all news about the schedule by email.

Overview schedule
9:30–10:00 Registration / Coffee
10:00–10:15 Welcome
10:15–11:00 Keynote: Implementing the FAIR Principles: Progress and Problems (Mark Wilkinson)
11:00–11:30 Plenary: Renku 2.0: Code, data and compute in the same platform for FAIR research (Elisabet Capon + Laura Kinkead)
11:30–12:00 Teaser Talks: Short presentations of show-and-tell topics
12:00–13:00 Show-and-tell parallel sessions 1–2
13:00–14:00 Lunch
14:00–14:30 Keynote: Building FAIR research repositories in practice (Lars Holm Nielsen, virtual talk)
14:30–15:00 Plenary: Beyond FAIR data: FAIR and reproducible workflows with AiiDA, Materials Cloud and AiiDAlab (Giovanni Pizzi)
15:00–15:30 Plenary: Building an RSE community in the ETH domain and steps towards a Swiss wide RSE community (Tarun Chadha + Uwe Schmitt)
15:30–17:00 Show-and-tell parallel sessions 3–5
17:00–17:10 Farewell
Full schedule

Slot 1
12:00–12:30		 Research Data in the Public Cloud
Jarunan Panyasantisuk (ETHZ) 		Assisting FAIRness lifecycle: SMART-metrics for FAIR research data lifecycle management
Federico Grasso Toro (UniBe) 		Cloud deployments for research projects
Simone Baffelli (Empa) 		A Platform for Simplifying and Accelerating Researcher Health Data Requests

Slot 2
12:30–13:00		 Research Data in the Public Cloud
Jarunan Panyasantisuk (ETHZ) 		OpenEM: Open electron microscopy data in Switzerland
Spencer Bliven (PSI) 		Reproducible workflows with AiiDA — The power and challenges of full data provenance
Julian Geiger + Marnik Bercx (PSI) 		Presentation of Beta Data Services & Outlook on EOSC Data Commons
Andrea Bertino (SWITCH)
13:00–14:00 Lunch
14:00–14:30 Building FAIR research repositories in practice (Lars Holm Nielsen, virtual talk)

15:30–16:00		 Data Pipeline for High-Throughput Parallel Electrochemical CO2 Reduction
Nukorn Plainpan (Empa) 		Assisting FAIRness lifecycle: SMART-metrics for FAIR research data lifecycle management
Federico Grasso Toro (UniBe) 		Reproducible workflows with AiiDA — The power and challenges of full data provenance
Julian Geiger + Marnik Bercx (PSI) 		Sharing pre-publication data across institutions via a project-specific data catalog
Nichole Wespe (UniBas)
Slot 4
16:00–16:30		 Data Pipeline for High-Throughput Parallel Electrochemical CO2 Reduction

Andrea Bertino (SWITCH)
